One idea for implementing a universal basic income could be to create a progressive tax system, where individuals with higher incomes pay a higher percentage of their income in taxes. This revenue could then be used to fund a universal basic income program.

Another idea could be to implement a carbon tax, where companies that emit high levels of carbon are taxed heavily. The revenue generated from this tax could be used to fund a universal basic income program.

A third idea could be to create a wealth tax, where individuals with a certain level of wealth are taxed heavily on their assets. The revenue generated from this tax could be used to fund a universal basic income program.

A fourth idea could be to implement a financial transaction tax, where companies that engage in high-frequency trading are taxed heavily. The revenue generated from this tax could be used to fund a universal basic income program.

A fifth idea could be to create a digital currency, where the government prints and distributes the currency to all citizens. The value of the currency could be used to fund a universal basic income program.
